data.title: The long history of the double
data.meta_description: Eagles are common and popular symbols of power ‚Äì considered the ‚Äúkings of the sky‚Äù, ruling families have long appropriated the symbolism of the free and mighty eagle as a projection of their own power, reach, and strength. However, the Austrian-Hungarian eagle that we are so familiar with in Vienna is unique in that somewhere [‚Ä¶]
